metadata.Title: CVE-2016-6232 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium
metadata.Description:
Directory traversal vulnerability in KArchive before 5.24, as used in KDEFrameworks, allows remote attackers to write to arbitrary files via a ../(dot dot slash) in a filename in an archive file, related to KNewsstuffdownloads.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-6232` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

kdelibs-bin - 4:4.14.34-0ubuntu2
kdelibs5-data - 4:4.14.34-0ubuntu2
kdelibs5-plugins - 4:4.14.34-0ubuntu2
kdoctools - 4:4.14.34-0ubuntu2
libkcmutils4 - 4:4.14.34-0ubuntu2
libkde3support4 - 4:4.14.34-0ubuntu2
libkdeclarative5 - 4:4.14.34-0ubuntu2
libkdecore5 - 4:4.14.34-0ubuntu2
libkdesu5 - 4:4.14.34-0ubuntu2
libkdeui5 - 4:4.14.34-0ubuntu2
libkdewebkit5 - 4:4.14.34-0ubuntu2
libkdnssd4 - 4:4.14.34-0ubuntu2
libkemoticons4 - 4:4.14.34-0ubuntu2

libknewstuff2-4 - 4:4.14.34-0ubuntu2
libknewstuff3-4 - 4:4.14.34-0ubuntu2
libknotifyconfig4 - 4:4.14.34-0ubuntu2
libkntlm4 - 4:4.14.34-0ubuntu2

libkpty4 - 4:4.14.34-0ubuntu2
libkrosscore4 - 4:4.14.34-0ubuntu2
libkrossui4 - 4:4.14.34-0ubuntu2
libktexteditor4 - 4:4.14.34-0ubuntu2
libkunitconversion4 - 4:4.14.34-0ubuntu2

libplasma3 - 4:4.14.34-0ubuntu2
libsolid4 - 4:4.14.34-0ubuntu2

Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: kde4libs package in esm-apps/bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4:4.14.34-0ubuntu2').
